oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of American soldiers with an ox team
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph shows an ox team hitched to a wagon with a boy standing on the wagon. Another civilian male's head is visible just beyone the rump of the oxen. Two American soldiers flank the oxen and both are wearing campaign hats. The photograph was most likely taken around Camp Sevier, South Carolina, the assembly point for National Guard units from Tennessee and the Carolinas that became the 30th Division. The Still Image belonged to Sgt. Ernest West, Batry. B, 114th F.A. Regt., 30th Div.
